name: Snake Plant Laurentii
description: The Snake Plant is a hardy and popular houseplant known for its striking, sword-like leaves with yellow edges. It's incredibly resilient and a great air purifier.
bestConditions: Thrives in low to bright indirect light. Water only when the soil is completely dry.
maxGrowth: Up to 4 feet tall.

name: Monstera Deliciosa
description: Famous for its iconic split leaves, the Monstera Deliciosa, or Swiss Cheese Plant, brings a lush, tropical feel to any room.
bestConditions: Prefers bright, indirect sunlight and consistent moisture. Likes humidity.
maxGrowth: Can reach up to 15 feet with support.

name: Golden Pothos
description: A forgiving and versatile plant with heart-shaped, green leaves variegated with yellow. Perfect for beginners and looks great in hanging baskets.
bestConditions: Adaptable to various light levels, from low to bright indirect. Water when top inch of soil is dry.
maxGrowth: Vines can grow over 10 feet long.

name: ZZ Plant
description: The ZZ Plant is nearly indestructible with its thick, waxy leaves that tolerate neglect. Great for beginners.
bestConditions: Tolerates low light and infrequent watering. Avoid overwatering.
maxGrowth: Up to 3 feet tall.

name: Fiddle Leaf Fig
description: With its large, violin-shaped leaves, the Fiddle Leaf Fig is a dramatic statement plant perfect for modern homes.
bestConditions: Needs bright, indirect light and consistent watering. Avoid sudden changes in location.
maxGrowth: Can grow up to 10 feet indoors.

name: Areca Palm
description: The Areca Palm is a beautiful, bushy palm with feathery fronds that adds a tropical vibe indoors.
bestConditions: Thrives in bright, indirect light and evenly moist soil.
maxGrowth: Can reach up to 7 feet indoors.

name: Peace Lily
description: The Peace Lily is known for its elegant white blooms and glossy green leaves. It’s also an excellent air purifier.
bestConditions: Prefers medium to low light. Keep soil consistently moist.
maxGrowth: Up to 3 feet tall.

name: Boston Fern
description: Boston Fern is a lush, feathery fern perfect for hanging baskets and humid spaces.
bestConditions: Prefers indirect light and high humidity. Keep soil moist.
maxGrowth: Fronds can grow up to 3 feet long.

name: Aloe Vera
description: Aloe Vera is a succulent known for its healing gel and easy care requirements.
bestConditions: Prefers bright, indirect light. Water sparingly, allowing soil to dry out completely.
maxGrowth: Up to 2 feet tall.

name: Jade Plant
description: Jade Plant is a long-living succulent with fleshy, oval leaves. Symbol of good luck.
bestConditions: Needs bright, indirect light. Water only when soil is dry.
maxGrowth: Can grow into a 3-foot tall shrub.

name: Rubber Plant
description: Rubber Plant has thick, glossy leaves and is an excellent air purifier. It brings a bold look to interiors.
bestConditions: Bright indirect light. Water when topsoil dries out.
maxGrowth: Can grow 8–10 feet indoors.

name: Philodendron Heartleaf
description: A trailing plant with beautiful heart-shaped leaves. Easy to grow and great in hanging pots.
bestConditions: Medium light preferred. Water moderately.
maxGrowth: Vines can reach 10 feet long.

name: Calathea Orbifolia
description: Known for its striking, large striped leaves, Calathea Orbifolia adds a dramatic touch indoors.
bestConditions: Needs indirect light, high humidity, and moist soil.
maxGrowth: Leaves can grow up to 12 inches wide.

name: Lavender
description: Lavender is famous for its fragrance and purple blooms. Great for gardens and relaxation.
bestConditions: Full sunlight, well-drained soil.
maxGrowth: Up to 3 feet tall.

name: Rose
description: Roses are classic flowering plants, available in many colors. Symbol of love and beauty.
bestConditions: Needs 6+ hours of sunlight and regular watering.
maxGrowth: Varieties range from 1–6 feet.

name: Tulsi (Holy Basil)
description: Tulsi is revered in India for its medicinal and spiritual importance.
bestConditions: Full sunlight and moderate watering.
maxGrowth: Up to 2 feet tall.

name: Bougainvillea
description: Bougainvillea is a colorful climbing plant with papery blooms that brighten any outdoor space.
bestConditions: Needs full sun and dry conditions.
maxGrowth: Can climb over 20 feet.

name: Hibiscus
description: Hibiscus produces large, vibrant flowers that attract pollinators.
bestConditions: Full sun and regular watering.
maxGrowth: Up to 8 feet tall.

name: Money Plant
description: Popular in Indian homes, Money Plant is believed to bring prosperity.
bestConditions: Indirect sunlight. Water when soil dries.
maxGrowth: Vines can reach 10–12 feet.

name: Spider Plant
description: The Spider Plant is known for its arching leaves and spider-like plantlets, which can be repotted to grow new plants. It's extremely easy to care for.
bestConditions: Prefers bright, indirect light but can tolerate low light. Water moderately.
maxGrowth: Up to 2 feet wide, with long plantlets.

name: Bird of Paradise
description: With its large, banana-like leaves, the Bird of Paradise brings a dramatic, tropical flair indoors. It can produce unique bird-shaped flowers under the right conditions.
bestConditions: Loves very bright, indirect light and high humidity. Water when the top 2 inches of soil are dry.
maxGrowth: Can reach over 6 feet tall indoors.

name: Chinese Money Plant
description: Also known as Pilea Peperomioides, this plant is famous for its unique, coin-shaped leaves and is thought to bring good fortune.
bestConditions: Bright, indirect light and weekly watering. Rotate it regularly to maintain a symmetrical shape.
maxGrowth: Up to 12 inches tall.

name: String of Pearls
description: A stunning trailing succulent with bead-like leaves that cascade down the pot, perfect for hanging baskets.
bestConditions: Bright, indirect light. Water sparingly, as it's drought-tolerant. Ensure good drainage.
maxGrowth: Strands can grow 2-3 feet long.

name: Anthurium
description: Anthuriums are loved for their bright, heart-shaped waxy flowers (spathes) and glossy green leaves, providing long-lasting color.
bestConditions: Bright, indirect light and high humidity. Keep soil consistently moist but not waterlogged.
maxGrowth: Up to 2-3 feet tall.

name: Marigold
description: Marigolds are cheerful, easy-to-grow flowers, widely used in Indian festivals and decorations for their bright orange and yellow blooms.
bestConditions: Full sun. Tolerates most soils but prefers well-drained soil.
maxGrowth: Up to 2 feet tall, depending on variety.

name: Croton
description: Croton plants are known for their vibrant, multi-colored foliage, featuring shades of red, orange, yellow, and green, often on the same leaf.
bestConditions: Needs very bright light to maintain its colors. Water when the top soil is dry.
maxGrowth: Can grow up to 6 feet tall.

name: Aglaonema (Chinese Evergreen)
description: One of the most durable houseplants, the Chinese Evergreen features beautiful patterned leaves and thrives in low-light conditions.
bestConditions: Tolerates low light but prefers medium, indirect light. Water moderately.
maxGrowth: Up to 2 feet tall and wide.

name: Jasmine (Mogra)
description: Known as Mogra in India, this plant produces intensely fragrant white flowers, often used in garlands and for religious offerings.
bestConditions: Full to partial sun and well-drained soil. Regular watering.
maxGrowth: Can grow as a shrub or a vine up to 10 feet.

name: Dracaena Marginata
description: Also known as the Dragon Tree, it has slender, arching leaves with red edges, giving it a unique, spiky appearance.
bestConditions: Bright, indirect light. Drought-tolerant, so allow soil to dry out before watering.
maxGrowth: Can reach up to 6 feet or more indoors.

name: Prayer Plant (Maranta)
description: The Prayer Plant is fascinating for its patterned leaves that fold up at night, as if in prayer. It's a slow-growing, low-spreading plant.
bestConditions: Bright, indirect light and high humidity. Keep soil consistently moist.
maxGrowth: Spreads to about 12 inches wide.

name: Echeveria
description: Echeverias are popular succulents that form beautiful rosette shapes and come in a variety of colors. Perfect for small pots and arrangements.
bestConditions: Needs lots of sunlight (at least 6 hours) and infrequent watering.
maxGrowth: Rosettes can be 2 to 12 inches in diameter.

name: Lucky Bamboo
description: Despite its name, it's not actually bamboo but a type of Dracaena. It's a popular gift plant in Feng Shui and Vastu for bringing good luck.
bestConditions: Can grow in water or soil. Prefers bright, indirect light.
maxGrowth: Can grow up to 3 feet tall.

name: Orchid
description: Orchids are exotic and elegant flowering plants that produce stunning, long-lasting blooms. They symbolize luxury and beauty.
bestConditions: Bright, indirect light and a specific orchid potting mix. Water once a week.
maxGrowth: Up to 3 feet tall.

name: Schefflera (Umbrella Plant)
description: The Umbrella Plant has glossy, oval leaves that droop gracefully from a central stalk, resembling an umbrella.
bestConditions: Prefers medium, indirect light. Water thoroughly and allow to dry out between waterings.
maxGrowth: Can grow up to 6 feet tall indoors.

name: Ponytail Palm
description: Not a true palm, this succulent has a swollen, bulbous trunk that stores water and a cascade of long, curly leaves resembling a ponytail.
bestConditions: Loves bright light and is very drought-tolerant. Water once every few weeks.
maxGrowth: Can slowly grow up to 6-8 feet indoors.

name: Neem Plant
description: The Neem tree is highly valued in India for its extensive medicinal properties, used in traditional remedies for centuries.
bestConditions: Needs full sun and well-drained soil. Very drought-tolerant once established.
maxGrowth: A fast-growing tree that can become very large.

name: Dieffenbachia (Dumb Cane)
description: Dumb Cane has large, variegated leaves in shades of green, cream, and white. Adds a lush, tropical look. (Note: sap is toxic if ingested).
bestConditions: Medium to low indirect light. Keep soil evenly moist.
maxGrowth: Can grow up to 5 feet tall.

name: Syngonium (Arrowhead Plant)
description: This easy-care plant has distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. It can be kept bushy or allowed to trail or climb.
bestConditions: Bright, indirect light. Water when the top inch of soil is dry.
maxGrowth: Vines can grow 3-6 feet long.

name: African Violet
description: African Violets are small houseplants that can bloom year-round with beautiful flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white.
bestConditions: Bright, indirect light (no direct sun). Water from the bottom to avoid spotting the leaves.
maxGrowth: About 6-8 inches in diameter.

name: Fittonia (Nerve Plant)
description: The Nerve Plant is known for its striking leaves with brightly colored veins in pink, white, or green. It loves high humidity, making it perfect for terrariums.
bestConditions: Low to medium indirect light and high humidity. Keep soil consistently moist.
maxGrowth: A low-growing creeper, up to 6 inches tall.

name: Kalanchoe
description: Kalanchoe is a cheerful succulent that produces clusters of tiny, long-lasting flowers in vibrant colors like red, orange, yellow, and pink.
bestConditions: Bright, indirect light. Water only when soil is dry.
maxGrowth: About 12 inches tall.

name: Peperomia
description: Peperomia is a large genus of small houseplants with a variety of interesting foliage textures and colors. They are non-toxic and easy to care for.
bestConditions: Medium to bright indirect light. Water when the top 1-2 inches of soil are dry.
maxGrowth: Typically under 12 inches tall.

name: Curry Leaf Plant (Kadi Patta)
description: An essential in South Indian cuisine, the Curry Leaf plant produces aromatic leaves used to flavor many dishes. A must-have for any Indian herb garden.
bestConditions: Full sun and well-drained soil. Water regularly.
maxGrowth: Can grow into a small tree, but can be kept small in a pot.

name: Lemon Grass
description: Lemongrass is a tall grass with a distinct citrusy fragrance and flavor, widely used in teas and Asian cuisine.
bestConditions: Loves full sun and plenty of water.
maxGrowth: Can grow up to 5 feet tall.

name: Haworthia (Zebra Plant)
description: A small, striking succulent with dark green leaves and white, zebra-like stripes. It's very hardy and great for small spaces.
bestConditions: Bright, indirect light. Water sparingly.
maxGrowth: Up to 5-6 inches tall.

name: Cast Iron Plant
description: True to its name, this plant is nearly indestructible. It can survive in very low light and with infrequent watering, making it perfect for beginners.
bestConditions: Thrives in low light conditions. Water only when the soil is completely dry.
maxGrowth: Up to 2-3 feet tall.

name: Air Plant (Tillandsia)
description: Air plants are unique because they don't need soil to grow. They can be mounted on wood, placed in terrariums, or displayed in creative holders.
bestConditions: Bright, indirect light. Submerge in water for 20-30 minutes once a week.
maxGrowth: Varies by species, typically 2-8 inches.

name: Parlor Palm
description: A classic, elegant houseplant, the Parlor Palm has been popular since Victorian times. It's slow-growing and adapts well to relatively low light.
bestConditions: Medium to low indirect light. Keep soil lightly moist.
maxGrowth: Can reach up to 4 feet tall indoors.

name: Bonsai Tree
description: Bonsai is the art of growing miniature trees in containers. Each tree is a unique, living work of art that requires careful cultivation.
bestConditions: Varies greatly by tree species. Generally requires specific watering, pruning, and light.
maxGrowth: Kept small through pruning, typically 1-3 feet.
